CONVERSATION GROUP: Ah, my savior came to pay a visit to my humble little shack!  Thanks to you, I was spared quite the gruesome fate!

And none the worse for wear I might add! Just... a little nauseated from the whole ordeal. I was stuck there for quite a while before you came along!  But with a nice warm meal in me, I'll be good as new!
I'm sorry I wasn't able to thank you properly back there, but I was in quite a hurry to leave that place.  I'm sure you understand.
I also wanted to make sure Irene here was alright.  She's been locked up in this place ever since... well... we lost our father.
I was hoping she'd at least be safe by staying inside, but now I'm not so sure there's any safe place left here.

A couple tendays ago, he disappeared while gathering wood out in the swamp.  We went searching for him, but there aren't a lot of able-bodied people here to go venturing out alone, and far too much ground to cover.

BK this is a huge chain of dialog. Trying to trim it up. Condensencing three lines into one.
We just have to move on.  I'm thinking it's time to leave this place.  Andra's been kind enough to take us in, but it's become too dangerous to stay.
Now I just need to convince Irene to come along with me...
She refuses to leave without our father, but it's been so long... I fear the worst for him.  But I went out to search anyway, for her sake.
BK cut "I'm not ready to give up just yet though!  Just need to get my strength back, then I'll try one more time."

We traveled here from Everlund, on our way to Mirabar. One night, there was a storm, and we lost the road. Before you knew it, we were lost in the moors. We survived only though Andra's hospitality... especially after my father's disappearance.
I hate to ask this of you after you've done so much already, but I'm not yet feeling strong enough for another search.  If you find any signs of our father, please let me know.

[Whispering] He'll be wearing an engraved ring, just like the ones my sister and I have.  If... if the worst has happened, please at least bring back his ring.  It symbolizes our family's bond.  We'll keep it in memory of him.
I don't think I'll ever manage to get Irene to leave so long as our father is still out there.
We just have to move on.  I'm thinking it's time to leave this place.  Even with that monster Andra gone, it's become too dangerous to stay...
Afraid I may have gotten bit with the spider's poison.  T-took an anti-toxin already, just waiting.  Waiting for the pain to die down...
looks like there isn't any conditional scripting on here though.
Enough, Irene.  They've brought back his ring as proof.  It's *groan* just as I feared.

BK I cut and renoded the dialog because the next line "But this is our home! The house father built for us!" seemed out of place. Didn't they wanter into this place from a storm and Andra let them stay?
I apologize for Irene. She's been this way ever since father went missing. I need to get her out of this damned place before she goes crazy from being cooped up in here.
No... no! We have to stay and wait for father. This is his home, the one he built!  He'll find his way back.
You should leave before father gets back. He doesn't like it when we let the other villagers into the house. Says they're not to be trusted.
Stay away from me! I have to go find my brother!  I have to go find father!
